com.ericdaugherty.lib.struts
Class ValidationService

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ericdaugherty.lib.struts.ValidationService
public class ValidationService
extends java.lang.Object

Provides the ability perform common input parameter validation compatible with Apache Jakarta's Struts. These methods perform validation on the parameters, and use add an ActionError if the fields are not valid.

The names of the ActionError string names are hard coded in this class. Here is a list of the strings used, along with an example. Please create an entry for each of these strings in your ApplicationResources.properties file.
-

  • validation.no.value - Please enter a value for this field.
  • validation.too.long - Please enter a value that is no longer than {0} charecter(s).
  • validation.wrong.length - Please enter a value between {0} and {1} charecters long.
  • validation.password.no.match - The passwords entered did not match.
  • validation.email.wrong.format - Please enter a valid email address (x@y.z).

Method Detail

validateField

public static boolean validateField(org.apache.struts.action.ActionErrors errors,
                                    java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String value)
This method verifies that the value parameter has a value.
Parameters:
errors - the ActionErrors instance to add new ActionError instances to.
name - the name of the bean parameter.
value - the value of the bean parameter.
Returns:
true if the value parameter has a value, false if it is null or an empty string.

validateField

public static boolean validateField(org.apache.struts.action.ActionErrors errors,
                                    java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String value,
                                    int max)
This method verifies that the value parameter is less than or equal to the max length. This method also verifies that the value is not null.
Parameters:
errors - the ActionErrors instance to add new ActionError instances to.
name - the name of the bean parameter.
value - the value of the bean parameter.
max - the maxmim size this field can be.
Returns:
true if the value parameter has a value, false if it is null or an empty string.

validateField

public static boolean validateField(org.apache.struts.action.ActionErrors errors,
                                    java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String value,
                                    int min,
                                    int max)
This method verifies that the value parameter is between the specified min and max values. This method also verifies that the value is not null.
Parameters:
errors - the ActionErrors instance to add new ActionError instances to.
name - the name of the bean parameter.
value - the value of the bean parameter.
Returns:
true if the value parameter has a value, false if it is null or an empty string.

This method verifies that the password parameters have values, are between the minimum and maximum values, and are in the correct format (x@y.zz)

validateEmailAddress

public static boolean validateEmailAddress(org.apache.struts.action.ActionErrors errors,
                                           java.lang.String emailAddress,
                                           int max)
This method verifies that the email address has a value and is in the correct format.
Parameters:
errors - the ActionErrors instance to add new ActionError instances to.
value - the value of the bean emailAddress.
max - the maximum size allowable for the email address field.
